Key Match Events: In the 85th minute, N'Golo Kante fed Kolo Muani, and his shot went in off Vertonghen to take Les Bleus through.
Pre-Game Insights: Both teams were looking for revenge, with Belgium seeking to avenge their 1-0 defeat against France in the semi-finals of the 2018 World Cup.
France had a point to prove at the Euros after going out in the last 16 three years ago on penalties to Switzerland.
The uncertain form of Antoine Griezmann has been a problem too.
Belgium coach Domenico Tedesco's reaction to his own side's unconvincing displays in the group stage was striking.
Post-Match Reflections: The lucky break sent the 2022 World Cup runners-up into a last-eight tie in Hamburg on Friday as they remain on course to become European champions for the third time.
Miscellaneous Highlights: France had lots of the ball, yet often looked untidy, imprecise and rather flat, with Griezmann appearing lost on the right wing.
Belgium were happy to sit back and thwart France and did not test opposition goalkeeper Mike Maignan at all in the first half.
There was a sense a goal might be coming as Mbappe accelerated inside and smashed a shot just over.
Maignan finally had to make a save 20 minutes from the end of normal time, to keep out a drive from Lukaku, and was called into action again to deny De Bruyne.
